meanings.sent1: The unmuffled laughter of the children filled the playground with joy.
meanings.sent2: The unmuffled music from the concert was heard throughout the neighborhood.
meanings.sent3: The unmuffled excitement of the puppy caused chaos in the living room.
meanings.sent4: Her unmuffled emotions were evident in her tear-streaked face.
meanings.sent5: The unmuffled colors of the sunset painted the sky in brilliant hues.

meanings.definition: To remove a muffler from (a vehicle)
meanings.sent1: He decided to unmuffled his motorcycle to make it louder.
meanings.sent2: The mechanic will unmuffled the car to check the exhaust system.
meanings.sent3: When he tried to unmuffled the truck, he accidentally dropped the muffler.
meanings.sent4: She carefully unmuffled the old car, revealing a rusty exhaust pipe.
meanings.sent5: The driver had to unmuffled the vehicle for the race to meet regulations.

meanings.definition: To make a loud noise without being muffled
meanings.sent1: The fireworks unmuffled in the night sky, dazzling everyone below.
meanings.sent2: The thunder unmuffled across the valley, shaking the windows.
meanings.sent3: The alarm clock unmuffled, startling him awake from a deep sleep.
meanings.sent4: Her voice unmuffled in anger, echoing through the empty hallway.
meanings.sent5: The lion's roar unmuffled through the jungle, announcing its presence.
